newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Aerolinas Argentinas doubles Maastricht cargo flights.
newsitem.headline: Aerolinas Argentinas doubles Maastricht cargo flights.

text.p: Aerolineas Argentinas will double its freighter flights to Buenos Aires from Maastricht Aachen airport this weekend to meet strong demand, Iberia's Dutch cargo manager, Ton Jansen said.
He told Reuters there will now be two flights a week from the Dutch airport to the Argentinean capital.
Iberia has a 10 percent stake in the Argentinean carrier and is responsible for selling the cargo service from the Netherlands.
The flights are is operated by a Boeing 747-200 freighter leased from the Michigan-based Kalitta Airlines departing Maastricht on Wednesdays and Sundays.
Commenting on why the airline has increased the flight frequency, Jansen said: "The freighter is always a 100 percent full, in and outbound."
Ironically, the British beef crisis has helped fill the aircraft on the return journey, as, the freighter is almost full of beef from Argentina for destinations all over Europe, he said.
It also carries some horse meat , he added. - Reuters Air Cargo Newsroom Tel+44 171 542 7706 Fax:5017
